detailsOfAchievement: A voluntary organization with head office at Bijapur is serving the under privileged section of the community in northern part of Karnataka since 1995. It is registered under Societies Registration act of 1860 bearing registration number of SOR.213/95-9. It is founded by a team of young professionals having technical qualification with the aim to empower poor people with resource and skill oriented activities. Today, it is successful in planning and implementing several pro-poor projects funded by various national and international organizations. The projects handled by the organizations are diverse in nature ranging from agriculture to fashion technology, animal husbandry to computer training to minority communities. The organization has the experience of handling several projects funded by various organizations like NORAD, DBT, DST, CAPART etc. The number of projects handled the nature of the projects and the budget sanctioned would positively reflect on the capability of the organization. The success of the projects is attributed to the organisationâ€™s capability to design need based projects coupled with meticulous planning and execution by involving target groups from the very beginning of the project cycle. Due to its commitment to the cause for which it has been established, the organization is perceived as highly reputed organizations not only by the donors but also by the rural people for whom it strives.

detailsOfAchievement: Vijnana Bharati is a national movement dedicated to the integrated development of Bharat through the intervention of science, engineering and technology. Vijnana Bharati takes the spirit of Swadeshi along with the ethos of our culture. It emphasises that the science and spirituality should go hand in hand. Vijnana Bharati works towards rural development, technology transfer and social empowerment so as to bring the fruits of advancement of science and technology for the benefit of the society. Received two national awards for popularising science and technology: one in 2006 from Dr. Manmohan Singh, Honorable Prime Minister of India and the other in 2007 from Shri. detailsOfAchievement: Formation of thirty four Children Clubs in 16 villages to promote talents and personality development Over thousand two hundred have benefited from this program Child right clubs and Balika sanghas formed at school and village level comprising an average of 25 members in each club and three or four clubs in thirty Panchayats to build leadership, get involved in local governing voicing out their problems etc Around three thousand children benefitted About 1500 people were educated on positive health and hygienic practices 7 school health programs to meet and make over 1400 students health conscious and live a healthy life style Awareness rallies with regard to Dengue HIV AIDS cleanliness open defecation Tobacco and Alcohol Children Rights Child Marriage Child Abuse Child labor and communicable diseases 2300 benefited from this awareness 70 economically poor children were sponsored and 7 sponsored children houses were renovated for better living 1320 children are reached through campaign and awareness on child right issues Formed and strengthened 34 Child rights clubs and children parliaments reaching out to some 1250 children Educational materials were supplied for the 210 children in the project area books bags pens pencils uniform study table chairs Imparted training for 80 village leaders regarding health RTF WASH SCSP STSP Government schemes Awareness on government schemes in 60 villages Vimukti Staff gave door to door awareness by distributing hand bills on various schemes like RTF free gas cylinder ration card Adhar card senior citizen card widow pension scheme disabled facilities As a result 9000 families benefited from this programme Supplementary education in sixteen villages attended by nine hundred fifty two children
